Struggling a bit with elementary DataFrames manipulations. Trying to add the columns 2 and 3 (A and B below) like this
```julia> df = DataFrame(dataset=["old", "new"], A=[5678,567], B=[876,987])
2×3 DataFrame
 Row │ dataset  A      B
     │ String   Int64  Int64
─────┼───────────────────────
   1 │ old       5678    876
   2 │ new        567    987

julia> transform(df, [2,3] => sum)
ERROR: MethodError: objects of type Vector{Int64} are not callable```
throws as you can see. How should I do that?

text: I would write this as `df."A+B" = df.A .+ df.B`- I love `transform!` as much as the next man, but I think unless you're Hadley Wickham or one of his close relatives it's not mandatory to use it for everything. That said, if you want to use it I would write it like `transform(df, [:A, :B] => ((a, b) -> a .+ b) => "A+B")`
